achievements.description: Led 400-member division developing next-generation radio frequency collection capabilities for contested environments worldwide, managing a $170M portfolio with on-time, on-budget delivery.
Drove a $70M multi-national modernization program across 7 countries, creating a dense ISR edge node architecture that enabled over-the-horizon targeting in a strategically important region.
achievements.impact_metric: $70M program across 7 countries; 4x ISR capability expansion.

achievements.description: Managed completion of 4,000 technical requirements to modernize 25-year-old collection systems, expanding regional ISR capacity fourfold.
Directed development and in-house build of three novel antenna designs, reducing procurement time by 8 months, cutting weight by 60%, and boosting performance by 25%.
achievements.impact_metric: 8 months faster delivery; 60% lighter; 25% performance gain.

achievements.description: Surged RF collection operations, achieving an 800% increase in system deployments and enabling identification and geolocation of over 1 million high-priority signals from hundreds of strategic targets.
Revived RF engineering training program for 42 engineers, closing critical skills gaps and preparing 31 military personnel for high-risk overseas deployments that concluded without incident.
achievements.impact_metric: Trained 42 engineers; enabled 6 incident-free hostile deployments.

achievements.description: Served as technical lead for a 181–189 member tri-service unit providing electronic warfare combat capability to the global USAF, USN, and USMC F-35 fleet, while maintaining a $380M mission data generation and test laboratory.

Normalized and scaled F-35 crowd-sourced flight data operations, ingesting 1.2 TB of operational data and analyzing 130+ pilot debrief events across three theaters, cutting analysis timelines tenfold.
achievements.impact_metric: 1.2 TB processed; 10x faster analysis; 130+ events analyzed.

achievements.description: Solved complex combat identification challenges in dense electronic warfare environments by optimizing 29 mission data files supporting 7 deployed units and 625 aircraft.
achievements.impact_metric: 29 mission data files optimized; 625 aircraft supported.

achievements.description: Led development of a common mission data format across platforms, reducing file sizes by 60x and enabling efficient sharing and reuse of reprogramming data across 70+ wing platforms.

Delivered a toolset that integrated 46 GB of data from 5 squadrons into emergency reprogramming workflows during Exercise Northern Edge, advancing toward the Secretary of the Air Force 3-hour rapid response goal.
achievements.impact_metric: 46 GB integrated from 5 squadrons; enabled rapid reprogramming.

achievements.description: Built an F-35 crowd-sourced flight data capability from scratch, standing up a 7-person team and developing software tools to analyze terabytes of operational data, supporting 123 events and driving 35 mission data parameter updates.
Developed advanced visualization tools that improved analyst efficiency by 99% and reduced processing time twelvefold, enabling timely delivery of five urgent updates to tri-service F-35 units.
achievements.impact_metric: 99% efficiency gain; 12x faster processing; 5 urgent updates delivered.

achievements.description: Excelled as interim Director of Operations for a 160-member tri-service squadron, meeting 100% F-35 production requirements and delivering 104 combat-credible software releases supporting five combatant commanders.
Orchestrated a comprehensive software production overhaul synchronizing six flights, two test lines, and a $350M laboratory, cutting production timelines by 43% and doubling mission coverage.
Spearheaded strategic automation investments that increased test capacity by 80%, enabling completion of 11 critical operational change requests and significantly improving F-35 survivability.
achievements.impact_metric: 80% capacity increase; 11 critical change requests completed.

achievements.description: Oversaw a $71M modernization program to equip two software test lines for Block 4 capabilities, securing conditions for 10+ years of F-35 combat software production.

Personally authored more than 1,500 lines of advanced Python code for an electronic warfare data visualization tool, significantly expanding the squadron’s data analysis capacity within a two-month period.
achievements.impact_metric: 1,500+ lines of code; delivered in 2 months.

achievements.description: Managed a 13-person staff responsible for personnel, contracting, facilities, and budget execution for a 160-member multi-service electronic warfare mission data unit.
Built $13M budget forecasts covering laboratory, personnel, and material costs, securing two years of funding for F-35 mission data requirements.
Directed a $9M facility construction project resolving critical infrastructure issues and preparing the squadron for 30% personnel growth.
Developed and executed COVID-19 response plans that sustained a 93% mission-capable rate for critical infrastructure while minimizing exposure risk for 140 personnel.

roles.title: Chief, GPS III Launch and Mission Operations

achievements.description: Directed a satellite operations team deploying next-generation GPS III/IIIF spacecraft as part of a $13B acquisition program serving more than 4 billion global users.
Led flawless launch and on-orbit checkout of the first two GPS III satellites, enabling declaration of initial operational capability for next-generation positioning services.
Managed and aligned two major acquisition programs totaling $16B, resolving five critical integration issues to deliver advanced positioning, navigation, and timing capabilities to warfighters.
Led a multi-satellite test team verifying more than 146 technical requirements that tripled user accuracy and provided warfighters an eightfold improvement in contested RF environments.
Proved a new $630M command and control system was ready for operational use by resolving 36 critical deficiencies and securing three-star general launch approval.

Deployed as Executive Plans Officer in Afghanistan, leading 65 high-visibility missions that safely moved 1,000+ distinguished visitors and senior NATO leaders to support strategic objectives for two four-star commanders.
Led a 100-member cybersecurity test team evaluating the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the $32B GPS enterprise, directing cyber and vulnerability assessments for 26 mission systems.
Commanded a 65-member multi-year cyber test program thoroughly evaluating a $5B command and control system, delivering accelerated reports that enabled GPS III launch.
Led the first-ever tabletop cyber evaluation of a $9B navigation system, identifying more than 75 critical security vulnerabilities and establishing a foundation for a cyber-secure GPS enterprise.
Directed a 35-member adversarial test team constructing a GPS ground system network replica that uncovered 15 systemic weaknesses and drove major cyber defense improvements.
Supervised advanced receiver cybersecurity evaluations across 400+ tests to support certification, enabling secure GPS receivers for more than 1 million weapon systems and 540+ program offices.
Directed 16 security tests spanning the GPS portfolio, overseeing verification of 10,000 security controls and expediting Risk Management Framework transition by 80%.
Reallocated $2.3M for advanced software analysis tools, expanding cybersecurity work capacity by 10,000 hours per year and increasing throughput by 300%.

roles.title: Deputy Chief, Integration and Operations Division
roles.organization: Sensors Directorate, Air Force Research Laboratory

achievements.description: Led a 124-member division aligning five mission support branches to provide continuous operational support for advanced sensor R&D, overseeing a $17M budget and managing $150M+ in capital assets.
Directed a facility reorganization that relocated 158 personnel, maximizing classified workspace utilization and increasing operational efficiency by 30%.
Led a 15-member rapid prototyping team developing sensor solutions, fielding three active shooter detection systems that improved crisis response and first-responder situational awareness.

Directed flight operations for a high-visibility small UAS test program, overseeing 14 months of operations that enabled ISR technology deployment supporting neutralization of multiple high-value targets.
achievements.impact_metric: 14 months of UAS ops; multiple HVTs neutralized.

achievements.description: Saved an $8M radar R&D program by renegotiating contract structures and refocusing technical objectives for anti-access/area denial environments, cutting time to IOC by 50% and reducing costs by $2.5M.
achievements.impact_metric: $8M program preserved; 50% faster IOC; $2.5M cost reduction.

roles.title: Deputy Chief, Radar Systems Branch
roles.organization: Sensors Directorate, Air Force Research Laboratory

achievements.description: Oversaw operations for a 17-member branch managing a $195M portfolio delivering innovative C4ISR and electronic warfare products for global Air Force missions.
Served as principal researcher for a $7.6M multiband imaging radar program providing advanced anti-jam, all-weather surveillance and expanding operational coverage sixteenfold.
Led a technical team on a $40M program developing real-time onboard target identification capabilities that reduced the kill-chain timeline tenfold.
Oversaw rapid development of a $68M ISR upgrade for counter-IED operations, executing a rigorous 10-week flight test program and delivering results in four months.

Shepherded a quick-reaction ISR effort for an urgent special operations requirement, achieving IOC in 19 weeks and enabling units to prosecute six high-value targets and remove 60+ IEDs in the first two months.
Completed a Master of Science in Electrical Engineering focused on low-observable technologies, conducting original research on miniaturization of the AFIT Random Noise Radar.
Developed a novel processing algorithm that improved radar computational speed 60-fold and demonstrated feasibility of a chip-based miniaturized radar, yielding an estimated $150K cost savings.
Served as squadron commander’s principal liaison to eight detachment and flight commanders across three bases, supporting developmental testing on 16 major weapon systems for seven major commands.
achievements.impact_metric: Supported 130-person squadron; 16 weapon systems; 7 major commands.

achievements.description: Led developmental flight test for a $339M MC-130W precision-guided munitions integration program, delivering new strike capability to special operations forces.
Directed a $160M radar warning receiver test effort, recovering from a three-month delay and accelerating system fielding to improve aircrew survivability.

Acted as lead flight test engineer for a $300M advanced technology demonstration of a tactical airborne chemical laser, executing 20 missions, increasing performance by 75%, and achieving first-ever engagement of a moving target.

Earned advanced Design of Experiments certification and applied statistical methods to electronic support measures testing, cutting lab time by two months and saving $200K while increasing technical learning.
Managed developmental test and evaluation for a new satellite communications capability, rapidly clearing it for use on six special operations weapon systems.

awards: Department of the Air Force Outstanding Senior Military Scientist/Engineer Award (2023)
Arthur S. Flemming Award for Outstanding Engineer – Air Force-level winner (2018)
DoD William J. Perry Team Award (2011)
SMC Production Corps Field Grade Officer of the Year (2019)
Air Combat Command Outstanding Engineer/Scientist Team Award (2013)
Meritorious Service Medal with Oak Leaf Clusters
Air Force Commendation Medal with Oak Leaf Clusters
Air Force Achievement Medal with Oak Leaf Clusters
certifications: Project Management Professional (PMP), Project Management Institute (2025)
Engineering and Technical Management Practitioner, DAWIA (2022)
